text: Elihu Extols God’s Majesty
“About this also my heart trembles,
and it leaps from its place.
Listen carefully to his voice’s thunder
and \add the\add* rumbling \add that\add* goes out from his mouth.
He lets it loose under all the heavens,
and his lightning to the earth’s corners.
After it, his voice roars;
it thunders ⸤with his majestic voice⸥,\f + \fr 37:4 \ft Literally “with \fq the \ft voice of his majesty” \f*
and he does not restrain it when his voice is heard.
“God thunders with his voice in marvelous ways;
he does great things, and we cannot comprehend.
For to the snow he says, ‘Fall \add on the\add* earth’;
and ⸤the shower of rain, his heavy shower of rain⸥\f + \fr 37:6 \ft Literally “\fq the \ft shower of rain and \fq the \ft show of rains of his strength” \f*—
⸤he stops all human beings from working⸥\f + \fr 37:7 \ft Literally “on the hand of all man he seals” \f*
⸤so that everyone whom he has made may know it⸥.\f + \fr 37:7 \ft Literally “to know all men of his work” \f*
Then\f + \fr 37:8 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* \add the\add* animal goes into \add its\add* den,
and it remains in its den.
“\add The\add* storm wind comes from its chamber
and cold from \add the\add* north wind.
By God’s breath, ice is given,
and \add the\add* broad waters \add are\add* frozen.
Also, he loads down thick clouds with moisture;
his lightning scatters \add the\add* clouds.
And ⸤they⸥\f + \fr 37:12 \ft Collective “clouds” in the first line takes the singular “it” here with the plural meaning \f* turn around by his guidance
to accomplish all that he has commanded them
on \add the\add* face of ⸤the habitable world⸥.\f + \fr 37:12 \ft Literally “world of earth” \f*
Whether as ⸤correction⸥\f + \fr 37:13 \ft Literally “a rod” \f* or for his land,
or as loyal love, he lets it happen.
“Hear this, Job;
stand \add still\add* and consider carefully God’s wondrous works.
Do you know ⸤how God commands them⸥\f + \fr 37:15 \ft Literally “at the putting of God upon them” \f*
and \add how\add* he causes his cloud’s lightning to shine?
Do you know about the hovering of the clouds,
⸤the marvelous works of the one with perfect knowledge⸥?\f + \fr 37:16 \ft Literally “\fq the \ft marvelous works of perfect knowledge” \f*
\add You\add* whose garments \add are\add* hot,
when \add the\add* earth is being still because of \add the\add* south wind,
with him can you spread out \add the\add* skies,
hard as a molten mirror?
“Teach us what we should say to him;
we cannot draw up our case because of \add the\add* presence of darkness.
Should he be told that I want to speak?
Or did a man say that he would be communicated with?
So then, they do not look at the light \add when it is\add* bright in the skies,
when\f + \fr 37:21 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* \add the\add* wind has passed and has cleansed them.
From \add the\add* north comes gold—
awesome majesty \add is\add* around God.
\add As for\add* Shaddai, we cannot attain him;
\add he is\add* exalted \add in\add* power,
and he does not oppress justice and abundant righteousness.
Therefore people revered him;
he does not regard any\f + \fr 37:24 \ft Or “all” \f* ⸤who think that they are wise⸥.”\f + \fr 37:24 \ft Literally “\fq the \ft wise of heart” \f*
